articles.title: Framework Ventures Is 'Optimistic That Regulators Are Much More Educated' About Crypto Than in Past

articles.description: Fanny Lakoubay, the founder of art advisory and agency LAL Art, talked to Decrypt's Liam Kelly at NFT Paris about what LAL Art does, how it works with artists, museums, directors, and galleries, and why artists in Web3 have to "reinvent themselves every six months."
articles.title: Why LAL Art Has 'No Interest In Just Putting the Traditional Art Market on the Blockchain'

articles.description: Anjali Young, the co-founder of Abridged and Collab.Land, talked to Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver about the origins of Collab.Land and says it erupted thanks to Covid, which created not just new interest in crypto but the need for better tools for DAO member collaboration.
articles.title: Collab.Land Grew 'Because of Covid' Creating Need for DAO Tools: Co-founder Anjali Young

articles.description: Visual artist Mat Collishaw, who uses mixed media to explore beauty, is about to launch Heterosis, a metaverse art experience with dynamic NFTs hosted by OG.Art. He spoke to Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris about how he came to Web3.
articles.title: Artist Mat Collishaw is Exploring the 'Mutability' of NFTs

articles.description: Samir Addamine, Co-founder and CEO of Web3 CRM software company Absolute Labs, told Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris that big consumer brands are rushing to figure out crypto wallets and how they can harness them for their marketing purposes and to deepen ties with customers.
articles.title: Absolute Labs CEO: Big Brands Are Trying to Understand and Harness Crypto Wallets

articles.description: Pseudonymous NFT collector Gmoney talks to Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris about his Web3 luxury brand 9dcc, big brands getting into NFTs, the debate over creator royalty fees, and what will come next to the space.
articles.title: NFT Collector Gmoney: 'Marketplaces Have Nothing to Trade Without Creators'

articles.description: Dispatch is a new Web3 marketing, messaging, and ad tech tool from IEX, the exchange fighting high-frequency trading and made famous in the book "Flash Boys" by Michael Lewis. Dispatch head of product Sean Spector sat down with Decrypt's Liam Kelly at NFT Paris to talk about Dispatch's product vision and why Web2 companies are jumping into Web3.
articles.title: Head of Product for IEX's Dispatch: 'We See Tokens as the Social Graph of Web3'

articles.description: Neal Stephenson coined the term “metaverse” in his seminal 1992 sci-fi hit novel “Snow Crash.” Now he’s helming a metaverse blockchain company called Lamina1 and advocating for one free and open metaverse. He spoke to Dan Roberts and Stephen Graves at length about what he got right and wrong in “Snow Crash,” goggles and flat screens, Big Tech, NFTs and digital ownership, and more. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.
articles.title: gm: Neal Stephenson Maps Out the Metaverse

articles.description: Omer Amsel, head of Web3 products at crypto custody and settlement provider Fireblocks, told Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver about why crypto market cycles are best for building, how Fireblocks is focused on providing "picks and shovels," and why the company still believes in the long-term promise of Web3.
articles.title: Fireblocks Is Laser-Focused on the Picks and Shovels: Web3 Products Lead at ETH Denver

articles.description: Mihai Crasneanu, Co-founder and CEO of Beem, describes Beem as "a mix of YouTube, Twitch, Zoom, and Clubhouse" that runs as a decentralized platform. He talked to Decrypt's Stephen Graves at NFT Paris about how it all works and how the platform is growing.
articles.title: CEO of Video Streaming Platform Beem: Decentralization Lets 'Creators Regain Their Autonomy'

articles.description: Miguel Faus funded his upcoming film "Calladita" via NFT sales and a prize grant from Decentralized Pictures and Steven Soderbergh. He told Decrypt's Stephen Graves at NFT Paris about how the film process is progressing and how Web3 moves so quickly that the NFT funding model he used is already a thing of the past and other filmmakers need to find other ways to keep pushing the envelope.
articles.title: 'Calladita' Director Says NFT Funding Model He Used Is Already Gone Because Web3 Moves So Fast

articles.description: Coinbase protocols lead Jesse Pollak sat down with Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver 2023 to talk about the company's innovation strategy and its plans to keep "iterating quickly" on products like Coinbase NFT and its newly announced Layer-2 blockchain Base and its efforts to become an "on-chain-native company."
articles.title: Coinbase Protocols Lead Talks Plans for Base and NFT Marketplace

articles.description: Josie Bellini, NFT artist and creator of CyberBrokers, tells Decrypt's Stephen Graves at NFT Paris how CyberBrokers creates "missions and quests" for its holders to complete that lead them to other hubs like Cryptovoxels, Mona, and other projects "so that we're not just in our own silo."
articles.title: How CyberBrokers Creates Quests Across Multiple NFT Communities: Josie Bellini

articles.description: Bolero co-founder and CEO William Bailey tells Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris how Bolero works, the vision behind letting fans of an artist own a piece of a song, the future for music NFTs, and how Web3 can change the music industry broadly.
articles.title: Web3 Music Platform Bolero Wants to 'Put a Record Label in Everyone's Pocket'

articles.description: French electronic music producer DJ Agoria told Decrypt's Dan Roberts what excites him most about music NFTs, how it informs his work as a generative artist, and why Web3 is all about artists exploring "new ideas that were not possible in Web2."
articles.title: 'We Don't Want to Make Music NFTs Mainstream': DJ Agoria

articles.description: Adidas Web3 lead Erika Wykes-Sneyd told Decrypt's Dan Roberts the story of what prompted Adidas to get into crypto (it involves Elon Musk), what the brand has done so far with NFTs tied to physical apparel, and what it's considering next—including token-gated sneaker drops.
articles.title: How Adidas Jumped Into Web3 and What It Plans Next

articles.description: Eva Assayag, Web3 lead at Panerai, sat down with Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris to talk about Panerai's Web3 strategy, which will soon include a "digital passport" sold with every watch.
articles.title: Why 160-Year-Old Luxury Watch Maker Panerai Is Getting into NFTs

articles.description: John Karp, president of NFT Factory Paris and the founder of Non-Fungible Conference Lisbon, spoke to Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris about the exploding Web3 community in Paris, the concept behind creating a physical gallery for NFTs, and how the existing art community understands NFTs because "everybody understands art."
articles.title: NFT Factory President: 'NFTs Will Be Active in a Bull or Bear Market'

articles.author: Savannah Fortis
articles.description:
In the wake of the Silicon Valley Bank collapse, Ripple CEO Brad Garlinghouse has assured investors that the company is in a strong financial position. 
 
There have been several cases of shuttered banks this month, which has affected many crypto firms. Some top banks, including Silvergate, Silicon Valley, and Signature bank, have shut down operations tying many firms’ funds in their vaults.
 
 
Top crypto firms such as Coinbase, Paxos, Celsius, and Circle have been affected due to their exposure to some banks. Also, many crypto assets traded in the red last week due to the bank’s crashes. 
 
Ripple Holds Strong Financial Position Despite SVB Collapse
 
In a Twitter post, Garlinghouse stated that while the loss of SVB was a blow, Ripple is doing enough to sustain normal operations on the n…
articles.title: Brad Garlinghouse Encourages Ripple Community Following SVB Collapse

articles.author: Jack Schickler
articles.description: The company had millions deposited with Silicon Valley Bank, but regulators intervened Sunday evening to safeguard all  customer monies.
articles.title: BlockFi Has Cash Access for Staff, Vendors Despite SVB Collapse: Attorney

articles.author: Jamie Redman
articles.description:
The U.S. Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation (FDIC) has announced that clients of Silicon Valley Bank (SVB) and Signature Bank (SBNY) can access their funds during normal banking hours on Monday, March 13, 2023. The FDIC stated that both banks’ deposits were made whole under the “systemic risk exception” approved by the U.S. Federal Reserve and Treasury Department.
 
Details on the Creation of Full-Service FDIC-Operated Bridge Banks
 
Customers who utilized Silicon Valley Bank (SVB) and Signature Bank (SBNY) will have access to their funds on Monday, following the FDIC’s actions to transform both banks into newly created full-service FDIC-operated bridge banks. SVB will now be known as “Silicon Valley Bank N.A.,” while Signature’s new name is “Signature Bridge Bank N.A.” Both bridge bank…
articles.title: FDIC Creates Bridge Banks for Failed Silicon Valley Bank and Signature Bank Clients to Access Funds

articles.author: Hououin Kyouma
articles.description:
Data shows the crypto futures liquidations have hit $238 million during the last 24 hours as Bitcoin has observed an uplift of 10%.
 
Bitcoin Liquidations Reach $238 million
 
Whenever an investor opens a futures contract on any derivative exchange, they first have to put forth some initial collateral called the margin. Such a contract can get liquidated if the holder amasses losses that have eaten away a specific portion of this margin.
 
By “liquidation,” what is meant here is that the derivative exchange forcefully closes the contract when losses of this specific degree are accumulated (the exact percentage may differ from platform to platform).
 
One factor that can raise the risk of any contract getting liquidated is “leverage.” The leverage is a loan amount that a holder may choose t…
articles.title: Crypto Liquidations Hit $238 Million As Bitcoin Jumps 10%

articles.author: Savannah Fortis
articles.description:
Nissan, a Japanese automotive brand, has made several developments in its brands over the years. It also aims to change the narratives of automobiles in the coming years. To embrace the future of technology and commerce, Nissan has filed four new web3 trademarks and is set to carry out trial sales in the metaverse.
 
 
The Japanese automaker has recognized the immense potential of blockchain technology and the metaverse in shaping the future of business. As such, Nissan has taken a proactive approach to stay ahead of the game.
 
Nissan Files New Web3 Trademarks
 
The company filed multiple trademark applications with the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) on March 7. It disclosed that the pilot program would collaborate with Decentraland, a virtual environment that facilitat…
articles.title: Nissan Ventures Into Web3 With Trademark Filings And Metaverse Sales Testing

articles.author: Eliman Dambell
articles.description:
Bitcoin moved back above $22,000, as the U.S. Treasury moved to avert a regional banking crisis, following the collapse of Silicon Valley Bank. The government confirmed that it will backstop depositors’ funds, giving full access to their capital. Ethereum also moved higher on the news.
 
Bitcoin
 
Bitcoin (BTC) rose back above $22,000 on Monday, as the U.S. Treasury confirmed it will backstop depositors’ funds.
 
This will be for both Silicon Valley Bank and Signature Bank, which become the second and third biggest banking failures in U.S. history.
 
Following a low of $20,475.60 on Sunday, BTC/USD surged to an intraday high of $22,728.52 to start the week.
 
 
Bitcoin chart by TradingView
 

 
 

 
The rally comes as bitcoin moved back above a floor at $20,000 on Saturday, surging to a ten-day high on Monday.
 
One of the catalysts of this move was a breakout of the 14-day relative strength index (RSI), which rose past a ceiling at 44.00.
 
As of writing, the index is tracking at 47.89, which is its strongest point since March 2.
 
 
Ethereum
 
Ethereum (ETH) was also back in the green to start the week, as traders moved to buy the recent dip in price.
 
ETH/USD climbed to an intraday peak of $1,629.37 earlier in the day, less than 24 hours after falling to a low at $1,468.74.
 
Similar to bitcoin, this move saw the world’s second largest cryptocurrency hit its highest point in the past tendays.
 
 
Ethereum chart by TradingView
 

 
 

 
Overall, ethereum is now trading 1.22% higher than at the same point last week, as bulls appear to have reentered the market.
 
This has resulted in a slight shift in momentum, with the 10-day (red) moving average now trending upwards.
 
Should this momentum continue, there is a strong chance that ETH could head back to resistance at $1,675.
 
Register your email here to get weekly price analysis updates sent to your inbox:
 
Has bearish sentiment fully faded in crypto markets? Leave your thoughts in the comments below.
articles.title: Bitcoin, Ethereum Technical Analysis: BTC Back Above $22,000 as Silicon Valley Bank Depositors Are Rescued

articles.author: Solomon Oladipupo
articles.description:
The Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS) has said that the collapse of Silicon Valley Bank (SVB) and other two US-based banks has limited impact on startups in its ecosystem, including those with operations in the United States.

The conclusion is based on initial feedback, MAS announced on Monday, noting that it is working closely with Enterprise Singapore, a statutory board under the country’s Ministry of Trade and Industry, to assess any potential impact of the developments on the country.

“MAS and other government agencies will continue to monitor the situation closely for any signs of stress,” the central bank noted.

Furthermore, the financial regulator noted that the Singapore banking system, on the whole, has “insignificant exposures” to the failed United States banks, adding that banks in the Asian country are “well-capitalized and conduct regular stress tests against interest rate and other risks.”

MAS also assured that the country’s banking system remains “sound and resilient,” adding that the Singapore Dollar money and foreign exchange markets “continue to function well.”

“MAS is closely monitoring the domestic financial system and international developments. MAS stands ready to provide liquidity through its suite of facilities to ensure that Singapore’s financial system remains stable and financial markets continue to function in an orderly manner,” the central bank explained.

This article was written by Solomon Oladipupo at www.financemagnates.com.
articles.title: SVB Crisis: Impact on Singaporean Startups Limited, Says Central Bank

articles.author: Thibaud Maréchal
articles.description:
Wasabi Wallet’s WabiSabi protocol is designed to eliminate change outputs from CoinJoins, better protecting Bitcoin users’ privacy.
 
         
         
         
         
    
This is an opinion editorial by Thibaud Maréchal, ​​a contributor to privacy-focused Bitcoin wallet project Wasabi Wallet.
Much ink has been spilled on the privacy horrors of change outputs for Bitcoin. It is now widely understood that Bitcoin is a pseudonymous network, where all users are identified by the addresses they use. When making a bitcoin transaction, instead of only sending the exact amount that is needed — like in traditional, account-based payment systems — you send all the sats from the original address into new ones. This creates a change output, which is the amount you get back when making a paymen…
articles.title: How to Deal With Toxic Change In CoinJoins

articles.author: Jake Simmons
articles.description:
The Shiba Inu Metaverse is the most highly anticipated project on Shibarium, the layer 2 technology from Shiba Inu, which saw its official beta launch on Saturday. And during the South by Southwest (SXSW) festival, the developers debuted an in-depth look through an immersive extended reality experience what it will look like in a portion of Metaverse’s realm, the WAGMI Temple Hub,
 
The WAGMI Temple is the first of 11 hubs in the SHIB metaverse and is named after the crypto rally cry “We’re All Going to Make It.” According to the official Shiba Inu token website, the Wagmi Temple offers “a Zen-like realm of calming sensations, meditation, natural beauty, and spiritual connections to the world” and is meant to guide users through SHIB’s history and the token’s discovery and decentralized ro…
articles.title: New Shiba Inu Metaverse Live Views Unveiled At SXSW Texas, Watch It Here
